meanings.definition: A person who tends cattle on a ranch
meanings.sent1: The cowhands fed the cattle every morning.
meanings.sent2: The rancher hired cowhands to help with the cattle.
meanings.sent3: The cowhands tried to ride the cows like horses, but it didn't work out.
meanings.sent4: The cowhands were the guardians of the ranch's precious cattle.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cowhands herding the cattle under the big sky stayed with him.

meanings.definition: The hands or workers employed on a cattle ranch
meanings.sent1: After a long day's work, the tired cowhands gathered around the campfire.
meanings.sent2: The cowhands repaired the fences to keep the cattle safe.
meanings.sent3: The cowhands had a friendly competition to see who could lasso a cow the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The cowhands' dedication to their work was as strong as the ranch's oldest oak tree.
meanings.sent5: The cowhands' laughter echoed through the valley as they worked together.
